sentence.Network_en: The hotheaded driver had another road accident.

sentence.Network_en: And robust scrutiny could give way to hotheaded revenge.

entry.tran: 头脑发热的;鲁莽的;性急的
entry.def: If you describe someone as hot-headed, you are criticizing them for acting too quickly, without thinking of the consequences.

means.word_mean: 2. characterized by undue haste and lack of thought or deliberation;

sentences.sentence: "liable to such impulsive acts as hugging strangers"
"an impetuous display of spending and gambling"

auth_sentence.content: Hotheaded kids who wanted to prove their manliness would challenge him to gunfights, and he would have to kill or be killed.
